page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT AROUND RIPPINGALE
page.content: {Employment in the district}has changed radically in the past 20 years.Both men and women were traditionally employed on the land but women have virtually left{agriculture}for light and service industries and only about 15% of the men who were in farming remain.This{mobility of labour}has been brought about largely by the use of cars and the upsurge of a large number of{small workshops}making a great variety of goods.In nearby towns articles as diverse as lightning conductors for South America,gloves for Harrods and parts for atomic power stations are made.Potters and other artisans have set up in the vicinity. It is,though,the car that has turned the labour force from a static to a mobile one.A proportion of the community is unemployed,reflecting the {serious nationwide shortage of jobs.
